title: How to Edit Photos on VSCO on Android

steps.headline: Open VSCO.
steps.description: VSCO has a white icon with a circular design in the middle. Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in to VSCO, tap Sign In then enter the email and password associated with your VSCO account and tap Sign In.

steps.headline: Tap the square icon with a circle in the middle.
steps.description: It's the third tab at the bottom of the screen. This is the Studio tab.

steps.headline:
Tap {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/77\/Android7new.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/7\/77\/Android7new.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

steps.description: It's the icon with a plus (+) sign in the middle. It's in the lower-right corner of the screen. This opens your photo gallery. If you want to take a picture with your camera, tap the icon that resembles a camera above the icon with a plus sign.

steps.headline: Tap the images you want to import.
steps.description: To select images from your gallery, tap them. You can select as many images as you want.

steps.headline: Tap Import.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the screen. This imports your photos into the VSCO studio.

steps.headline: Open VSCO and sign in.
steps.description: Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in, type the email address and password associated with your VSCO account to sign in.

steps.headline: Tap the square icon with a circle in the middle.
steps.description: This is the Studio tab. This displays a list of photos you have imported into the Studio.

steps.headline: Tap a photo you want to edit.
steps.description: When you tap an icon, VSCO displays the editing icon in the lower-right corner. See Part 1 to learn how to import photos into the Studio.

steps.headline: Tap the icon with two circles on two lines.
steps.description: It resembles two slider bars. This icon appears in the lower-right corner when you tap a photo you want to edit. This icon is not available if you select more than one photo. If you select more than one photo, tap the X icon in the lower-left corner to deselect all photos. Then tap a single photo you want to edit.

steps.headline: Tap a filter at the bottom of the screen.
steps.description: The filters are listed in a row at the bottom of the screen. Each filter displays a thumbnail preview of the image with the filter applied. Swipe left on the row to view more filters. Tap a filter you would like to apply to your image. To change how the filters are listed, tap the icon that resembles a photograph in the lower-left corner. Then tap an icon that resembles the arrangement you want. The icon with 9 squares displays 9 filter previews on screen at a time. The icon with 4 squares displays 4 larger filter previews on screen at a time. The large square displays one large filter preview on screen at a time.

steps.headline: Tap the filter again.
steps.description: When you select a filter, a line with a small circle appears over the filter icon at the bottom of the screen. Tap this icon to adjust the filter.

steps.headline: Drag the slider bar.
steps.description: The slider is below the image. Drag the white dot to the left to lower the amount of the effect the filter applies to the image.

steps.headline:
Tap {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5a\/Android7done.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/5\/5a\/Android7done.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760,"licensing":"

steps.description: The checkmark icon is in the lower-right corner. This applies the filter to the image.

steps.headline: Tap Save.
steps.description: This saves the image with the filter applied.

steps.headline: Open VSCO and sign in.
steps.description: Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in, type the email address and password associated with your VSCO account to sign in.

steps.headline: Tap the square icon with a circle in the middle.
steps.description: This is the Studio tab. This displays a list of photos you have imported into the Studio.

steps.headline: Tap a photo you want to edit.
steps.description: When you tap an icon, VSCO displays the editing icon in the lower-right corner. See Part 1 to learn how to import photos into the Studio.

steps.headline: Tap the icon with two circles on two lines.
steps.description: It resembles two slider bars. This icon appears in the lower-right corner when you tap a photo you want to edit. This icon is not available if you select more than one photo. If you select more than one photo, tap the X icon in the lower-left corer to deselect all photos. Then tap a single photo you want to edit.

steps.headline: Tap the icon with two circles on two lines.
steps.description: It's the same icon that resembles two slider bars. It's the second tab at the bottom of the screen that resembles a photograph. This displays the photo editing tools.

steps.headline: Tap Exposure.
steps.description: It's the first icon that resembles a sun at the bottom of the screen. Exposure effects how much light is captured in a photo. Use the following steps to change the image exposure. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Drag the dot to the right to enhance the bright parts of the photo. Drag the photo left to enhance the darker parts of the photo. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply exposure.

steps.headline: Tap Contrast.
steps.description: It's has an icon that resembles a circle that is half full and half empty. Contrast effects the difference between the maximum and minimum intensity of the photo brightness and color. Use the following steps to apply contrast. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Drag the dot to the right to enhance the photo contrast. Drag it to the left to decrease the photo contrast. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply contrast.

steps.headline: Tap Adjust.
steps.description: It has an icon that resembles two corner lines forming a square. This is where you can crop and straighten the image. Use the following steps to adjust the photo. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Dragging this photo right and left slightly rotates the photo. Drag the white dot until the subjects in the photo appear straight. Drag the white dots around the photo inward. The white dots in the corners of the photo are the cropping handles. Drag the handles inward and place them around the subject of the photo. The dark parts of the photo outside the white boxes is the part of the photo that will be removed when the photo is cropped. For the best results, align the key subjects of the photo with the white lines inside the box. You can also tap one of the preset aspect ratio boxes at the bottom of the screen. To move the cropping square, tap the center and drag it. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply your adjustments to the photo.

steps.headline: Tap Sharpen.
steps.description: It's the icon that resembles a triangle at the bottom of the screen. Sharpening a photo enhances the detail of the photo. Use the following steps to sharpen your photo. Drag the white dot right. The white dot on the line below the image is the slider bar. Drag it to the right to sharpen the image. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply sharpen to the photo.

steps.headline: Tap Saturation.
steps.description: It's the icon that resembles a circle with a light and dark gradient at the bottom of the screen. Saturation enhances color intensity of a photo. Use the following steps to apply saturation to a photo. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Dragging the slider bar to the right enhances the color of the image. Dragging it to the left makes the color look duller. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply saturation.

steps.headline: Tap Tone.
steps.description: It's the icon that resembles a circle that is half full and half empty with an H and an S in the middle. Tone can enhance the color in both the highlights and shadows of an image. Use the following steps to change the tone of an image. Drag the Highlights bar to the right to enhance the image highlights. This enhances the color of the lighter parts of an image. Drag the Shadows bar to the right to enhance the image shadows. This enhances the darker parts of the image. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply tone adjustments.

steps.headline: Tap Save.
steps.description: After you have applied all the edits you want to the photo, save the photo by tapping Save in the upper-right corner.

steps.headline: Open VSCO and sign in.
steps.description: Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in, type the email address and password associated with your VSCO account to sign in.

steps.headline: Tap the smiley face icon.
steps.description: This is the Profile icon. It's in the lower-right corner of the app.

steps.headline: Tap the gear icon.
steps.description: The gear icon is in the upper-left corner of the app. This displays the settings menu.

steps.headline: Tap Join VSCO X.
steps.description: It's at the top of the Settings menu next to "Membership". This displays a web page for VSCO X.

steps.headline: Tap Join VSCO X.
steps.description: It's the blue button on the web page. A VSCO X membership unlocks all filters and editing tools. VSCO X costs $19.99 per year, or $1.67 a month. A free trial is available to new users.

steps.headline: Tap Subscribe.
steps.description: It's the green button that appears at the bottom of the page. This starts a subscription through the Google Play Store.

text:
Importing Photos Open VSCO. VSCO has a white icon with a circular design in the middle. Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in to VSCO, tap Sign In then enter the email and password associated with your VSCO account and tap Sign In. Tap the square icon with a circle in the middle. It's the third tab at the bottom of the screen. This is the Studio tab. If you want to take a picture with your camera, tap the icon that resembles a camera above the icon with a plus sign. Tap the images you want to import. To select images from your gallery, tap them. You can select as many images as you want. Tap Import. It's at the bottom of the screen. This imports your photos into the VSCO studio. Using Photo Filters Open VSCO and sign in. Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in, type the email address and password associated with your VSCO account to sign in. Tap the square icon with a circle in the middle. This is the Studio tab. This displays a list of photos you have imported into the Studio. Tap a photo you want to edit. When you tap an icon, VSCO displays the editing icon in the lower-right corner. See Part 1 to learn how to import photos into the Studio. Tap the icon with two circles on two lines. It resembles two slider bars. This icon appears in the lower-right corner when you tap a photo you want to edit. This icon is not available if you select more than one photo. If you select more than one photo, tap the X icon in the lower-left corner to deselect all photos. Then tap a single photo you want to edit. Tap a filter at the bottom of the screen. The filters are listed in a row at the bottom of the screen. Each filter displays a thumbnail preview of the image with the filter applied. Swipe left on the row to view more filters. Tap a filter you would like to apply to your image. To change how the filters are listed, tap the icon that resembles a photograph in the lower-left corner. Then tap an icon that resembles the arrangement you want. The icon with 9 squares displays 9 filter previews on screen at a time. The icon with 4 squares displays 4 larger filter previews on screen at a time. The large square displays one large filter preview on screen at a time. Tap the filter again. When you select a filter, a line with a small circle appears over the filter icon at the bottom of the screen. Tap this icon to adjust the filter. Drag the slider bar. The slider is below the image. Drag the white dot to the left to lower the amount of the effect the filter applies to the image. "}. The checkmark icon is in the lower-right corner. This applies the filter to the image. Tap Save. This saves the image with the filter applied. Using Photo Editing Tools Open VSCO and sign in. Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in, type the email address and password associated with your VSCO account to sign in. Tap the square icon with a circle in the middle. This is the Studio tab. This displays a list of photos you have imported into the Studio. Tap a photo you want to edit. When you tap an icon, VSCO displays the editing icon in the lower-right corner. See Part 1 to learn how to import photos into the Studio. Tap the icon with two circles on two lines. It resembles two slider bars. This icon appears in the lower-right corner when you tap a photo you want to edit. This icon is not available if you select more than one photo. If you select more than one photo, tap the X icon in the lower-left corer to deselect all photos. Then tap a single photo you want to edit. Tap the icon with two circles on two lines. It's the same icon that resembles two slider bars. It's the second tab at the bottom of the screen that resembles a photograph. This displays the photo editing tools. Tap Exposure. It's the first icon that resembles a sun at the bottom of the screen. Exposure effects how much light is captured in a photo. Use the following steps to change the image exposure. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Drag the dot to the right to enhance the bright parts of the photo. Drag the photo left to enhance the darker parts of the photo. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply exposure. Tap Contrast. It's has an icon that resembles a circle that is half full and half empty. Contrast effects the difference between the maximum and minimum intensity of the photo brightness and color. Use the following steps to apply contrast. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Drag the dot to the right to enhance the photo contrast. Drag it to the left to decrease the photo contrast. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply contrast. Tap Adjust. It has an icon that resembles two corner lines forming a square. This is where you can crop and straighten the image. Use the following steps to adjust the photo. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Dragging this photo right and left slightly rotates the photo. Drag the white dot until the subjects in the photo appear straight. Drag the white dots around the photo inward. The white dots in the corners of the photo are the cropping handles. Drag the handles inward and place them around the subject of the photo. The dark parts of the photo outside the white boxes is the part of the photo that will be removed when the photo is cropped. For the best results, align the key subjects of the photo with the white lines inside the box. You can also tap one of the preset aspect ratio boxes at the bottom of the screen. To move the cropping square, tap the center and drag it. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply your adjustments to the photo. Tap Sharpen. It's the icon that resembles a triangle at the bottom of the screen. Sharpening a photo enhances the detail of the photo. Use the following steps to sharpen your photo. Drag the white dot right. The white dot on the line below the image is the slider bar. Drag it to the right to sharpen the image. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply sharpen to the photo. Tap Saturation. It's the icon that resembles a circle with a light and dark gradient at the bottom of the screen. Saturation enhances color intensity of a photo. Use the following steps to apply saturation to a photo. Drag the slider bar left or right. The slider bar is the large white dot on a line below the photo. Dragging the slider bar to the right enhances the color of the image. Dragging it to the left makes the color look duller. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply saturation. Tap Tone. It's the icon that resembles a circle that is half full and half empty with an H and an S in the middle. Tone can enhance the color in both the highlights and shadows of an image. Use the following steps to change the tone of an image. Drag the Highlights bar to the right to enhance the image highlights. This enhances the color of the lighter parts of an image. Drag the Shadows bar to the right to enhance the image shadows. This enhances the darker parts of the image. Tap the checkmark icon in the lower-right corner to apply tone adjustments. Tap Save. After you have applied all the edits you want to the photo, save the photo by tapping Save in the upper-right corner. Upgrading Your Membership Open VSCO and sign in. Tap the VSCO icon on your homescreen or apps drawer to open VSCO. If you are not already signed in, type the email address and password associated with your VSCO account to sign in. Tap the smiley face icon. This is the Profile icon. It's in the lower-right corner of the app. Tap the gear icon. The gear icon is in the upper-left corner of the app. This displays the settings menu. Tap Join VSCO X. It's at the top of the Settings menu next to "Membership". This displays a web page for VSCO X. Tap Join VSCO X. It's the blue button on the web page. A VSCO X membership unlocks all filters and editing tools. VSCO X costs $19.99 per year, or $1.67 a month. A free trial is available to new users. Tap Subscribe. It's the green button that appears at the bottom of the page. This starts a subscription through the Google Play Store.
